text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly mentions the Berne Convention in Section 2 under the 'Legal Framework in Italy' table, stating: 'Berne Convention, EU InfoSoc Directive (2001/29/EC)'. Furthermore, in Section 3.4, step 1, it states: 'Confirm ownership \u2013 locate the original registration (U.S. copyright registration, if any, is persuasive evidence in Italy under the Berne Convention).' This directly addresses the requirement that the response states the Berne Convention requires a country to recognize the works of citizens of other member countries as if they were those of its own citizens (the principle of national treatment, which is the core requirement of the Berne Convention mentioned here in the context of evidence recognition).", "criterion_id": "ddfed86c-3643-4be8-a571-37be17cefdde"}
